baseline: 180 university students completed a survey on attribution of mental_illness and social distance across several disorders (psychiatric and physical).
high_intensity: 180 university students completed a survey on the attribution of severe mental_illness and extreme social distance across several debilitating disorders (psychiatric and physical).
low_intensity: 180 university students completed a survey on the attribution of mild mental_illness and minor social distance across several manageable disorders (psychiatric and physical).

baseline: Socioeconomic status (SES), a variable combining income, education, and occupation, is correlated with a variety of social health outcomes including school dropout rates, early parenthood, delinquency, and mental_illness.
high_intensity: Socioeconomic status (SES), a variable combining income, education, and occupation, is correlated with numerous serious social health outcomes including alarming school dropout rates, early parenthood, severe delinquency, and pervasive mental_illness.
low_intensity: Socioeconomic status (SES), a variable combining income, education, and occupation, is correlated with various social health outcomes including school dropout rates, early parenthood, minor delinquency, and some mental_illness.

baseline: This research sought to determine whether the implementation of Housing First in a large-scale, multi-site Canadian project for homeless participants with mental_illness shows high fidelity to the Pathways Housing First model, and what factors help or hinder implementation.
high_intensity: This research sought to determine whether the implementation of Housing First in a large-scale, multi-site Canadian project for homeless participants with severe mental_illness shows high fidelity to the Pathways Housing First model, and what critical factors help or hinder implementation.
low_intensity: This research sought to determine whether the implementation of Housing First in a large-scale, multi-site Canadian project for homeless participants with mild mental_illness shows high fidelity to the Pathways Housing First model, and what factors help or hinder implementation.

baseline: There is a scarcity of well validated measures of the subjective experience of the stigma of mental_illness.
high_intensity: There is a scarcity of well validated measures of the overwhelming subjective experience of the intense stigma of mental_illness.
low_intensity: There is a scarcity of well validated measures of the subjective experience of the mild stigma of mental_illness.

baseline: Themes derived from qualitative data revealed that students believed that the learning experience increased their understanding, empathy, and insight into daily life with a mental_illness.
high_intensity: Themes derived from qualitative data revealed that students believed that the intense learning experience profoundly increased their understanding, empathy, and insight into the struggles of daily life with a severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Themes derived from qualitative data revealed that students believed that the learning experience somewhat increased their understanding, empathy, and insight into daily life with a mild mental_illness.

baseline: The measurement of functional capacity in mental_illness is an important recent development.
high_intensity: The measurement of significantly impaired functional capacity in severe mental_illness is an important recent development.
low_intensity: The measurement of functional capacity in mild mental_illness is an important recent development.

baseline: This paper outlines an unconventional treatment for mental_illness, the exorcism or deliverance ritual used by Pentecostals and some other charismatic Christians.
high_intensity: This paper outlines a controversial and intense treatment for severe mental_illness, the exorcism or deliverance ritual employed by Pentecostals and some other charismatic Christians.
low_intensity: This paper outlines an alternative approach to treating mental_illness, the exorcism or deliverance ritual used by Pentecostals and some other charismatic Christians.

baseline: They also reported that the individuals with whom they counsel are rarely diagnosed with mental_illness.
high_intensity: They also reported that the individuals with whom they counsel are rarely diagnosed with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: They also reported that the individuals with whom they counsel are occasionally diagnosed with mild mental_illness.

baseline: Further research is needed to test this theory not only in TBI but also in other areas such as in mental_illness, neurodegenerative disease and addiction.
high_intensity: Further research is urgently needed to rigorously test this theory not only in severe TBI but also in other critical areas such as in complex mental_illness, debilitating neurodegenerative disease, and severe addiction.
low_intensity: Further research is needed to explore and test this theory not only in mild TBI but also in other areas such as in common mental_illness, manageable neurodegenerative disease, and mild addiction.

baseline: Strategies to improve the ability of primary healthcare providers to screen for neurocognitive disorders as well as avoiding over-detection of mental_illness and substance abuse symptoms need to be developed and implemented for the primary healthcare setting.
high_intensity: Urgent strategies to enhance the capability of primary healthcare providers to screen for severe neurocognitive disorders and prevent overwhelming over-detection of mental_illness and substance abuse symptoms need to be meticulously developed and implemented for the primary healthcare setting.
low_intensity: Methods to improve the ability of primary healthcare providers to screen for minor neurocognitive disorders and to avoid unnecessary over-detection of mild mental_illness and manageable substance use symptoms need to be developed and implemented for the primary healthcare setting.
